ngiemboon: Lombowam la gwɔ́ tà ńgÿo lefùɔ sé tʉte, tà ńgyá ngie à pǔ ńgwɔ́ tántʉ̀, à te gíŋ ńtÿɔ́gɔ kwò na lepʉ̌ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ metsèm pú ńgÿo yɔ́b páʼ yé.
en: When Rehoboam had established his sovereignty and royal power,   he abandoned the law of the Lord  #— #he and all Israel with him.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ na mbɔ́ɔntè ngùʼ tʉ̂a páʼ Yelobowam la cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ, Shʉshÿag gẅie aa fùɔ Egíbtò tó ńtága Yelúzálèm lé ncù, mélàʼmie pɔ́ la gÿo mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a te ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.
en: Because they were unfaithful to the Lord, in the fifth year of King Rehoboam, King Shishak   of Egypt went to war against Jerusalem  # 12:2 1Kg 14:25

ngiemboon: Shʉshÿag laa gẅiin mekélêg ncù ntsáʼ né nkÿo pʉ́a (1 200), ńgẅiin pakwɔ́ʼ melÿóon móm ntɔgɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo palÿɔ́ʼncù tà é gyɔ́ɔn pie é la fó Egíbtò, mbɔɔ pà fó Limbi ńgÿo pà fó Suki, tà mbɔɔ pà fó Etíyopìa.
en: with 1,200 chariots, 60,000 cavalrymen, and countless people who came with him from Egypt #— #Libyans,   Sukkiim, and Cushites.

ngiemboon: À la kẅé memǎa metÿǒsoŋ Yúndà, ḿbiŋ ńgʉa né Yelúzálèm.
en: He captured the fortified cities   of Judah and came as far as Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Shÿemaya gẅie aa ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé gʉa ńgyá Lombowam pâ metándá pʉ̀a Yúndà pie é la cúʼte Yelúzálèm, á fʉ̀ʼ gie Shʉshÿag la ne ńtóo. Á gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Ayɔɔn, Cʉ̀apʉa ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi la gwáʼa wɔ́ɔn! Mèŋ yɔ́ɔn, n gwaʼá gẅí gí na mbwó Shʉshÿag.»
en: Then the prophet Shemaiah   went to Rehoboam and the leaders of Judah who were gathered at Jerusalem because of Shishak. He said to them, “This is what the Lord says: You have abandoned me; therefore, I have abandoned you to Shishak.”  # 12:5 Dt 28:15,25; 2Ch 15:2

ngiemboon: Afùɔ pâ mekěm Ésàlayɛ leen ńké ńzẅíŋe mefʉa wɔb, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Anò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn, áa nénʉ́!»
en: So the leaders of Israel and the king humbled themselves and said, “The Lord is righteous.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gyá púʼu, ńgíŋ ńgɔɔn mbwó Shÿemaya ngie: «Afʉ̀ʼ gie pɔ́ zẅiŋé mefʉa wɔb la, gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie n te pyága wɔ́b wɔ́. Á cʉ́ʼʉ ńzága pɔ́ mejʉʼ mèŋ n gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́, mélàʼmie n te cʉate pɔ́ na Shʉshÿag tá pfɛte gyáŋalóŋ yɔ́ɔn na pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm wɔ́.
en: When the Lord saw that they had humbled themselves, the Lord’s message came to Shemaiah: “They have humbled themselves; I will not destroy them but will grant them a little deliverance.   My wrath will not be poured out on Jerusalem through Shishak.  # 12:7 2Ch 34:25–27; Ps 78:38

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge zɔɔn cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ menkwɔɔn Shʉshÿag, tá fó mǒ é zsé ngie lefaʼa mbwó mèŋ pɔ́ lefaʼa mbwó mefùɔ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, à te tàʼa mmó wɔ́.»
en: However, they will become his servants so that they may recognize the difference between serving me and serving the kingdoms of other lands.”

ngiemboon: Shʉshÿag gẅie aa fùɔ pa Egíbtò la tág pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm, ḿbú ńkaa shúm fùʼ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mbɔɔ se nɔʼ, ńkaa mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ntsèm mie fùɔ Salémo la nyɛte.
en: So King Shishak of Egypt went to war   against Jerusalem.  # 12:9 2Ch 12:2 He seized the treasuries of the Lord’s temple and the treasuries of the royal palace. He took everything. He took the gold shields that Solomon had made.  # 12:9 2Ch 9:15–16

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu, afùɔ Lombowam gÿo mé nyɛte tsɔ́ mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù me tʉ̌ ŋwʉ̀ ńnáa mbwó metándá papyɛ́b ncwò nkáʼa nɔʼ, ńdɔg ńkúbe mɛ̌ ŋwɛ́.
en: King Rehoboam made bronze shields to replace them and committed them into the care of the captains of the guards   who protected the entrance to the king’s palace.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ ntsèm gie fùɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńgee né ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, palÿɔ́ʼncù pé kaa mekʉ́ʼʉ ncù ŋwɛ́ ńdɔgɔ ńgee ńtsege yé, ńgÿo ńgíŋe ńdɔgɔ ḿbiŋe nzèm ńtÿɔ́gɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ndá gie pɔ́ leʼe shúm sɔ́b wó.
en: Whenever the king entered the Lord’s temple, the guards would carry the shields and take them back to the armory.

ngiemboon: Lombowam la sẅíʼi mbùm ye mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a te gíŋe ńgyáŋa lóŋ na yé wɔ́, ńké te pú ḿbyága yé wɔ́. Mélàʼmie anò mbòŋo la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ lefùɔ Yúndà.
en: When Rehoboam humbled himself, the Lord’s anger turned away from him, and he did not destroy him completely.   Besides that, conditions were good in Judah.  # 12:12 2Ch 19:3

ngiemboon: Lombowam la gwaa cʉ́ʼʉ fùɔ, ńgẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b wémɔʼɔ́ né móm lekùɔ. Má we gwɔ́ Naama, ńgwɔ́ múɔ Amoŋ, lefùɔ sé la gwɔ́ tà ńtʉte, á sáʼ pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm na ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b sɔɔnmbʉ́a né legém. Áa tÿǒsoŋ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tsɔ́ʼ lélɔg ńnyɛ ngie aa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pʉ̀a pé.
en: King Rehoboam   established his royal power in Jerusalem. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city the Lord had chosen from all the tribes of Israel to put his name.  # 12:13 Dt 12:5; 1Kg 9:3 Rehoboam’s mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonite.

ngiemboon: Lombowam la gÿo nò tepòŋ. À la te néŋ ntʉ́m wé ntsèm na lefaʼa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Rehoboam did what was evil, because he did not determine in his heart to seek the Lord.

ngiemboon: Píte menò Lombowam, léfó nzyeté, ńgʉa ńkúu nzsoté, aa we ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne mefàʼ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé Shÿemaya, mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ye Endo, ngyàjʉʼ. Áa tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ ŋwàʼne, mé gíŋ ńgyá mezíŋ pʉ̀a na tsìŋendá Yúndà. Ncù lɔ́ɔn ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ Lombowam pɔ́ Yelobowam pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm.
en: The events   of Rehoboam’s reign, from beginning to end, are written in the Events of the Prophet Shemaiah  # 12:15 2Ch 12:5 and of the Seer Iddo concerning genealogies.  # 12:15 2Ch 9:29; 13:22 There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam throughout their reigns.

ngiemboon: Lombowam la kwé, mé túŋo yé Yelúzálèm á jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd. Míŋ we Ambiya jÿó ndá ye.
en: Rehoboam rested with his ancestors and was buried in the city of David. His son Abijah  ,# 12:16 1Kg 14:31–15:8 became king in his place.
